title: How the pleated skirt came to divide the nation - and how to wear it now
text:
When I canvassed the fashion team about pleated skirts, I knew the response would be passionate. I just didn’t anticipate which way. Now I know how David Cameron feels.

I love pleated skirts. The freedom, the generosity of fabric (all those folds keep you cool in the summer, warm in the winter; it’s like having your own built-in thermostat) and the sense that you’re not drawing attention to unloved lumps and bumps. Not for nothing have they been a consistent bestseller everywhere from Marks & Spencer and Boden to Me + Em and The Fold. So someone agrees with me.
